wikipedia_page.main: Kathryn Findlay (26 January 1953 – 10 January 2014) was a Scottish architect.

response: The sculpture was engineered by the Global engineer Arup, who developed the overall geometry, structural design and the building services including the lighting displayed extensively during the Olympic games. Architectural input by Kathryn Findlay (Ushida Findlay Architects, as a sub-consultant to Arup) made the sculpture into a functional building, for example designing the staircase.
* Kathryn Findlay (1954–2014), worked in Japan 1979 to 1999, before returning to the UK

Ushida Findlay was originated in Japan, set up in 1986 by husband and wife team, Eisaku Ushida and Kathryn Findlay. They came to the UK in 1999, setting up the practice in Edinburgh.Steve Rose The rural renewal of Kathryn Findlay, The Guardian, 19 July 2009. Retrieved 2012-06-14. However, the couple split-up and the company experienced financial difficulties, filing bankruptcy in 2004. Findlay launched her own separate practice.
* January 10 – Kathryn Findlay, British-born architect working in Japan (b. 1953)
*Kathryn Findlay, 60, British architect, brain tumour.Kathryn Findlay obituary
* 2014 – Kathryn Findlay, architect, for "her outstanding contribution to the status of women in architecture."
